bibdata.title: IEEE Approved Draft Standard for Local and metropolitan area networks--Media Access Control (MAC) Security
Amendment 3:Ethernet Data Encryption devices
IEEE Approved Draft Standard for Local and metropolitan area networks--Media Access Control (MAC) Security - Amendment 3:Ethernet Data Encryption devices
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE P802.1AEcg/D1.6, November 2016 (Draft Amendment to IEEE 802.1AE-2006 as amended by IEEE 802.1AEbn-2011 and IEEE 802.1AEbw-2013)

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: This amendment specifies Ethernet Data Encryption Devices (EDEs). An EDE is a two port bridge that uses MACsec to provide secure connectivity for attached customer bridges, or for attached provider bridges. EDEs may allow the customer (or provider) bridges to continue to use a VLAN Identifier (VID) in transmitted frames to select (as already specified in 802.1Q) between provider network or provider backbone network services.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
